EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Hey {!Contact.FirstName},
TCS have some amazing opportunities for you to get involved in this half term! Be a part of our CAT Teams and be funded up to £500 to run your own social action project! Or sign up to be an NCS Changer and have YOUR say on our programme.
CAT Teams:
CAT Teams are social action teams made for you and your fellow grad mates to get creative and run social action projects on an issue that YOU are passionate about; you could be funded up to £500 to run your own project, it's all down to you! If you want to get involved and run your own social action project, it's simple! You attend a session, bring your grad mates along, form a team and put forward your ideas on what social action project you would like to run. We will help you come up with a solid plan and on NCS Action Day your team will be pitching your idea to dragons to receive funding.
REMEMBER: The larger your team the greater your chance of receiving more funding.
The first CAT Team meeting will be held on the 19th February 1pm-3pm at The Challenge Waterloo Office. Address: Elizabeth House, Mezz Floor, 39 York Road, SE1 7NQ
Order you ticket here! NCS Changers:
Be a NCS Changer and help shape our NCS Programme! Come together to give us your feedback and ideas and help us to shape the future of NCS!
NCS Changers will have the opportunity to work alongside our programmes team in order to share their ideas and thoughts on our NCS Programme and will work to help improve it for the future generation of young people.
Interested? Have YOUR say and sign up HERE!
Like us on facebook and follow us on twitter to be kept up to date with the latest information.
If you have any questions do head to our fantastic new website www.tcssouthlondon.co.uk or email us at tcs.westlondon@the-challenge.org
